qas.question: What did King George IV originally want the structure to be?
King William thought about converting the palace into what after a fire destroyed the Palace of Westminster in 1834?
Which architect helped modify the house into a palace?
In what year was Nash removed as architect?
Who was hired in 1830 to finish the work on the palace?
What year did remodeling of Buckingham House begin?
What was George IV's original plan for the house?
What year did the king decide to make it into a palace?
Who was the main architect that transformed the house into the palace?
Who did King William IV hired to finish the work after Nash was fired?
What did King George IV originally make the structure to be?
Which architect helped modify the palace into a house?
What year was Nash promoted as architect?
Who was fired in 1830 to finish the work on the palace?
What year did remodeling of Buckingham House become banned?

context: Remodelling of the structure began in <a5_0><b14_0>1762<b14_0/><a5_0/>. After his accession to the throne in 1820, King George IV continued the renovation with the idea in mind of <a0_0><a6_0><b10_0>a small, comfortable home<b10_0/><a6_0/><a0_0/>. While the work was in progress, in <a7_0>1826<a7_0/>, the King decided to modify the house into a palace with the help of his architect <a2_0><a8_0><b11_0>John Nash<b11_0/><a8_0/><a2_0/>. Some furnishings were transferred from Carlton House, and others had been bought in France after the French Revolution. The external façade was designed keeping in mind the French neo-classical influence preferred by George IV. The cost of the renovations grew dramatically, and by <a3_0><b12_0>1829<b12_0/><a3_0/> the extravagance of Nash's designs resulted in his removal as architect. On the death of George IV in 1830, his younger brother King William IV hired <a4_0><a9_0><b13_0>Edward Blore<b13_0/><a9_0/><a4_0/> to finish the work. At one stage, William considered converting the palace into the <a1_0>new Houses of Parliament<a1_0/>, after the destruction of the Palace of Westminster by fire in 1834.
